headline: Crowded GOP field for Pennsylvania governor has some party leaders concerned
sentences:
HARRISBURG, Pa. â€”
A big Republican primary field for governor in Pennsylvania is spurring growing discomfort among party leaders that a widely splintered primary vote could produce a winner who cannot beat Democrat Josh Shapiro in November's general election.

The 10 Republican candidates are:
Lou Barletta
Jake Corman
Joe Gale
Charlie Gerow
Melissa Hart
Doug Mastriano
Bill McSwain
Jason Richey
Dave White
Nche Zama
Race is on for county election offices in Pennsylvania to get ready for May primary

Sam DeMarco, the GOP chairman of Allegheny County, said party leaders don't want a weak or polarizing candidate for the general election to win the primary election thanks to a splintered primary vote.

Video above: Exhibit highlights Pennsylvania state Capitol artwork
Ten Republicans filed paperwork this week to get on the May 17 primary ballot.
That is more than party leaders expected and it has propelled them to try to persuade some weaker candidates to drop out.
